qas.question: For about how many years was Old English used?
In what century was Old English first used?
In what century did Old English cease to be used?
According to Albert Baugh, what was the period in which Old English was used?
About what percentage of Old English words are not present in Modern English?
Where did Anglo-Saxons settle in the 500's?
What language stopped being used in Britain during the 1100's?
Who claims Old English was in use for from 450 to 1150 years?
85% of what language is still in use today?

context: <b6_0>Old English<b6_0/> was not static, and its usage covered a period of <a0_0>700<a0_0/> years, from the Anglo-Saxon settlement of <b5_0>Britain<b5_0/> in the <a1_0>5th<a1_0/> century to the late <a2_0>11th<a2_0/> century, some time after the Norman invasion. While indicating that the establishment of dates is an arbitrary process, <b7_0>Albert Baugh<b7_0/> dates Old English from <a3_0>450 to 1150<a3_0/>, a period of full inflections, a synthetic language. Perhaps around <a4_0>85<a4_0/> per cent of <b8_0>Old English<b8_0/> words are no longer in use, but those that survived, to be sure, are basic elements of Modern English vocabulary.
